An 8-year construction started in 1887 and completed in 1895 and designed by Jose Maria Villa, is a suspension bridge 291 meters long. This communicates to Santa Fe de Antioquia Olaya, bypassing the Cauca River. It was declared a national historic monument in 1978. \ n

The architecture that has survived through the years gives Santa Fe de Antioquia city the appearance of a "stagnant" in colonial times, so that the city itself was declared a national monument. Building from the XVI, XVII and XVIII 
 Churches of the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries. 
 - Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception 
 - Church of Santa Barbara 
 - Our Lady of Chiquinquirá 
 - Church of Jesus Nazareno 
 - Church of San Pedro Claver
